The intent action `com.aiautomation.ACTION_AUTOMATION_RESULT (used to send a broadcast)` matches the intent filter of a non-exported receiver, registered via a call to `Context.registerReceiver`, or similar. If you are trying to invoke this specific receiver via the action then you should use `Intent.setPackage(<APPLICATION_ID>)`.

The intent action `com.aiautomation.ACTION_STOP (used to send a broadcast)` matches the intent filter of a non-exported receiver, registered via a call to `Context.registerReceiver`, or similar. If you are trying to invoke this specific receiver via the action then you should use `Intent.setPackage(<APPLICATION_ID>)`.

The intent action `com.aiautomation.ACTION_STOP (used to send a broadcast)` matches the intent filter of a non-exported receiver, registered via a call to `Context.registerReceiver`, or similar. If you are trying to invoke this specific receiver via the action then you should use `Intent.setPackage(<APPLICATION_ID>)`.

The intent action `com.aiautomation.ACTION_STOP (used to send a broadcast)` matches the intent filter of a non-exported receiver, registered via a call to `Context.registerReceiver`, or similar. If you are trying to invoke this specific receiver via the action then you should use `Intent.setPackage(<APPLICATION_ID>)`.

Provide a timeout when requesting a wakelock with `PowerManager.Wakelock.acquire(long timeout)`. This will ensure the OS will cleanup any wakelocks that last longer than you intend, and will save your user's battery.

This folder configuration (`v26`) is unnecessary; `minSdkVersion` is 26. Merge all the resources in this folder into `mipmap-anydpi`.
